oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Protection order granted to William Harrison, Jr., Williamson County, Tennessee, by Head-Quarters District of Nashville, Provost Marshal's Office, 1864 April 25
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A protection order granted to William Harrison, Jr., of Williamson County, Tennessee, by Head-Quarters District of Nashville, Provost Marshal's Office on April 25, 1864. The document cites protection granted for "farm, timber, forage, stock, buildings, provisions, and all personal property not above mentioned. All officers and soldiers in the United States Service are directed to respect and, if nece[s]sary, enforce the requirements of this order." This document was issued "by command of Maj. Gen. Rousseau" and signed by Horace Tompkins, 1st Lt. of the 19th Michigan Infantry and Asst. Provost Marshall. Forms part of the Harrison House Collection. 1 document : b & w ; 20 x 25 cm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Harrison, William, 1825-1889; Tompkins, Horace
Harrison House (Franklin, Tenn.); Confederate States of America--Social life and customs
